info.name: user
info.title: Values vs References
info.description: When we pass a primitive type as an argument on a function, the function makes aÂ copyÂ of the original value, and works with it.When we pass an object as an argument on a function, the function makes aÂ copy of the referenceÂ that points to the place of the memory where the object is stored. This copy is a value itself, is not a reference. Through this value, the original object can be modified from inside of a function.
